basics.name: Jonathan Keane
basics.label: ML Researcher
basics.summary: I want to understand why AI models learn specific solutions when not specified mathematically. By understanding how these models think better, we can make them safer/more capable in the future. As a result, I am interested in AI interpretability, NLP for language understanding, and RL for reasoning.

work.name: Direct Supply
work.summary: Worked on multiple data science and ML systems for senior living solutions.
highlights: Product Search Tool: Worked within a team to develop product search system that became a trade secret in the company
Product Search Tool: Created method for enhancing dense embedding searches based on existing product relations
Menu Planning Tool: Developed a procedure to allow for smooth flipping of dense embeddings to newer embeddings models

Menu Planning Tool: Created a comprehensive evaluation system for several key workflows in system to evaluate different LLM options efficiently, communicating results in a series of white papers to share with other data scientists

work.name: Master's Capstone
work.summary: Published in ICMLA 2025. Train reinforcement learning (RL) agents with reward decomposition for the social deduction game Coup to identify/eliminate lying in agents.
highlights: Implemented Coup environment in Python, along with a league play-based training process for agents
Created custom agent neural network in PyTorch with LSTM for representing hidden information, based on similar RL agents used for playing poker
Proposed novel technique called strategy masking that would use decomposed reward predictions to isolate lying behavior and systematically remove it to encourage agent honesty
Performed literature review to learn about explainability/interpretability techniques in RL environments

work.name: Undergraduate Researcher
work.summary: Published in MICS 2023 (Oral). Build an understanding of the state-of-the-art Transformer model, design an experiment to understand/improve the state-of-the-art model further, and write/publish a paper describing results.
highlights: Performed literature review to understand the architecture and internal mechanisms of a Transformer
Proposed an experiment to improve upon the state-of-the-art model, and adjusted Python repository's code for training model with experimental adjustments
Presented research paper in regional conference and MSOE's ROSIE Supercomputer Challenge, sponsored by NVIDIA, winning 1st prize in the innovation challenge

mentoring.summary: Train a music transformer for generating music and apply recent interpretability research from Anthropic to understand how transformers represent music internally.
highlights: Mentored four undergraduates, teaching them about transformers and AI interpretability research
Currently guiding each group member through creating a music transformer, aiding the group with meetings discussing AI concepts or tools for working more effectively on a supercomputer

mentoring.summary: Published in MICS 2025 (Oral). Create a computer vision system to extract individual player statistics based on game footage.
highlights: Mentored five undergraduates, teaching them about common computer vision techniques
Created framework for creating SAM 2 prompts from finetuned YOLO player predictions to create individual player video segmentations
Trained a CNN in TensorFlow for key point detection and applied homography to field images
Team presented research at conference and competed in MSOE's ROSIE Supercomputer Challenge, sponsored by NVIDIA, winning 3rd prize

mentoring.position: Raider Stats Soccer Tracking Website Mentor/Developer
mentoring.summary: Create website to track MSOE soccer practice results and promote team competition.
highlights: Mentored 5 undergraduate students to learn more about databases, websites, and deployment
Used AWS resources (Amplify, S3, Elastic Container Registry, API Gateway, Lambda, RDS) to host a website written in React and backend API services written in Python
Developed custom database schema in Postgres SQL and login system with JWTs for secure API access
Website has been successfully used by the MSOE men's soccer team for 4 seasons and the men's soccer coach is actively requesting more features

volunteer.summary: Community service project through MSOE Honors Program.

projects.name: Slime Particle Simulation
projects.organization: MS Machine Learning Independent Study Project
projects.summary: Create a slime particle simulation project to demonstrate capabilities with creating highly parallelizable algorithms on a GPU.
highlights: Implemented a simulation of physarum polycephalum particles as a GPU-parallelized particle simulation in CUDA C based on existing research of these simulations
Adjusted algorithm to allow for particles to take on different colors based on different 'food types' being consumed
Used CUDA GL to create a real-time visualization of the slime simulation as a final deliverable of the project

projects.name: LinkedIn Message Automation
projects.summary: Create piece of software that automates the process of sending individual LinkedIn messages to groups of contacts in the LinkedIn network of CPA Leadership Institute.
highlights: Worked with Director of Communications to create programs in Java and Python to automate LinkedIn message sends (scraped/interacted with HTML via Selenium), progressing towards a final GUI application
Stored contact database in SQL database with localized MySQL server
Implemented from scratch autocomplete searching of contacts stored in the database using custom data structures. Used this functionality as a contact search feature in the final GUI

Negotiated initial developer fee and payment plan for use of program as software-as-a-service. The system replaced a manual process by sending over 5,000 messages automatically, allowing for more regular marketing to reach prospects directly with far less time spent by the marketing department

projects.name: MyYoutube Filter
projects.summary: Produced Desktop application to utilize YouTube API to retrieve only the most recent videos from a user's YouTube subscriptions to help users improve productivity by reducing clicks on mildly interesting content on normal YouTube homepage.
highlights: Created project using Node JS and NWJS to create Desktop application based around JavaScript code
Allowed user to login using OAuth authentication to permit application to get user-specific YouTube subscriptions and load most recent videos from specified YouTube channels
Currently use the application personally during busy periods at school to make sure that I am staying productive

awards.title: 1st Place - ROSIE Supercomputer Competition (sponsored by NVIDIA)
1st Place - Midwest Instruction and Computing Symposium Programming Competition
3rd Place - ICPC North Central North American Regional
1st Place - Midwest Instruction and Computing Symposium Programming Competition
3rd Place - ICPC North Central North American Regional

cocurricular.name: MSOE NCAA Men's Soccer Team
cocurricular.summary: Balanced athletics with academics while serving as team leader and academic mentor.
highlights: During fall season, balanced 2-hour daily practice and game travel (20 hrs/wk) with full-class schedule
As study tables lead tutor, organized weekly 2-hour sessions for younger students to come in and work on homework/get tutoring help
Tutored teammates in calculus/math, programming, and physics

cocurricular.name: MSOE Competitive Programming Team
cocurricular.summary: Participated in competitive programming competitions including ICPC.
